net.java.jddac.common.type
Interface ArgArray.UnitsConverter

Enclosing class:
ArgArray
public static interface ArgArray.UnitsConverter

The UnitsConverter interface provides a mechanism to attach advanced unit conversion capabilities to certain get methods. The conversion primarily assists with scaled integer representations commonly used with J2ME implementations without floating point capability. For example, a J2ME implementation may want to keep track of a distance as scaled integer with a resolution of thousands of a meter (mm) but it may be specified by the user or another source as Km or m. This class facilitates the conversion between scaled integer representations. One form of the convertUnits member function allows the current value to be specified as a floating point string.

Method Summary
 long convertUnits(long value, java.lang.Object fromUnits, java.lang.Object toUnits)
          Convert a long value and convert it to a new unit.

Method Detail

convertUnits

long convertUnits(long value,
                  java.lang.Object fromUnits,
                  java.lang.Object toUnits)
Convert a long value and convert it to a new unit.

Parameters:
value - - the value to convert to new units.
fromUnits - - the unit representing the current value.
toUnits - - the desired result unit of the returned value.
Returns:
- the new value embodied as toUnits.

convertUnits

long convertUnits(java.lang.String value,
                  java.lang.Object fromUnits,
                  java.lang.Object toUnits)
Given a string form of a number (possibly in floating point), convert it to be a long value in the destired units. This is useful in a J2ME CLDC1.0 environment to convert something like "3.141" KVolts into a long mVolts (3141000) scaled integer representation.

Parameters:
value - - A string representing the value. Can include floating point.
fromUnits - - the unit representing the current string value.
toUnits - - the desired result unit of the return value.
